node.text: Gina Chersevani (@mixtressdc) runs one of the coolest spots around, @BuffaloBergenDC, where you’ll find everything from fountain drinks to cocktails, all served alongside bagels, knishes, latkes, and more. Pull up a virtual seat at their bar, and if you’re in DC, be sure to swing by and check out their offerings. 📹 @buckbaymedia

node.title: Throwing it back to one of our 2019 #Imbibe75 People to Watch.

node.text: @ShihoFukada filmed this beautiful video about shochu’s history and culture, how it’s made, and how to use it in cocktails—it will instantly transport you to Japan and inspire you to try shochu yourself. And to learn more about Japanese shochu, be sure to follow @jss_shochu. #shochu #shochucocktail #jss_shochu #partnerpost #imbibe #imbibegram

node.title: The story of Japanese shochu is rich and layered.

node.text: Brewing a batch of Chemex coffee every morning is one of our favorite daily rituals. The classic brewer is a cinch to use, but there are a few little tricks to getting it just right, so our friends @AllegroCoffee put together a helpful how-to. Check it out before you brew your next batch! #chemex #coffeebrewing #coffeefliicks #imbibe #imbibegram

node.text: Lately, we’ve been daydreaming about traveling to Charleston and taking a seat at #TheLivingRoom bar @TheDewberryCharleston, helmed by @prettyprettyryancasey. Join us on a virtual trip to one of our favorite cities and bars. #charlestonsc #charlestonlife #hotelbar #imbibe #imbibegram 📹 @buckbaymedia

node.title: What bars and cities do you miss visiting these days?

node.text: Figuring out the right grind for your favorite brewing methods is key, so our friends @allegrocoffee put together this handy video to break it all down. #coffeefliicks #coffeeathome #coffeegrinder #imbibe #imbibegram

node.title: Have you dialed in your daily coffee grind?

node.accessibility_caption: Photo shared by Imbibe on September 10, 2021 tagging @cooperscraft. May be an image of drink and indoor.

node.text: Ready to mix some Boulevardiers for Negroni Week? Head to the link in our profile to read about our latest Drink of the Week, @CoopersCraft Barrel Reserve.

node.accessibility_caption: Photo shared by Imbibe on September 09, 2021 tagging @imbibe, @bulldog_gin, @bolscocktails, @campariofficial, @cinzano.official, @cooperscraft, and @campariusa. May be an image of text.

node.text: Tomorrow is the deadline for #NegroniWeek 2021 registration! If you haven’t had a chance to sign up yet, head on over to negroniweek.com. We have an amazing list of nonprofit partners this year who are doing impactful work around the world. The festivities begin on Monday, and there’s only one day left to get your bar or restaurant on board, so be sure to also head to negroniweek.com today! ❤️

user.full_name: J U S T I N   H A Z E L T O N

node.accessibility_caption: Photo by Imbibe in Leah & Louise with @justindrinks, @iamcoopernicus_, and @leah_and_louise. May be an image of drink and food.

node.text: Any Virgos out there? This cocktail’s for you! At @Leah_And_Louise, Justin Hazelton (@justindrinks) uses seasonal ingredients in the rotating Zodiac Punch to highlight qualities of each astrological sign. For last fall’s recipe, he combined rum, mint syrup, lime juice, Angostura bitters, and plums at their ripest to “display a balance and detail that only the perfectionist Virgo can attain.” Check it out via the link in our profile. 📸 @iamcoopernicus_

node.accessibility_caption: Photo by Imbibe on September 08, 2021. May be an image of 1 person and indoor.

node.text: If ever there was a person qualified to compile a compendium on the monumentally vast topic of cocktails and spirits, it’s David Wondrich. A James Beard Award–winning author, drinks writer, cocktail historian, educator, and comparative literature PhD and former English professor, Wondrich aligned his passion for both drinks and research as he served as editor in chief for The Oxford Companion to Spirits & Cocktails. Working on the project for nearly a decade, Wondrich was assisted by associate editor Noah Rothbaum (@street_bottle), and the team assembled contributions from around 160 writers of the modern drinks zeitgeist, including Imbibe executive editor Paul Clarke (@cocktailchron) and digital editor @EmmaJanzen. With the impressive tome finally hitting shelves later this fall, @PenelopeBass caught up with Wondrich about the scope of the project, what he learned in the process, and the joy of falling down a rabbit hole—link in our profile. 📸 @DanielGSilbert

node.accessibility_caption: Photo by Imbibe in Death & Taxes with @deathandtaxesreno. May be an image of drink.

node.text: September feels like a good time to reach for the maple syrup, and this cocktail from @DeathAndTaxesReno offers the perfect way to use it by combining a rosemary-infused maple syrup with bourbon, bianco vermouth, and lemon juice. Get the recipe from Ivan Fontana via the link in our profile. 📸 Sadie Bonnette

node.accessibility_caption: Photo shared by Imbibe on September 07, 2021 tagging @joshmbernstein, and @matthew.gilson. May be an image of drink and indoor.

node.text: "The 2010s belonged to IPAs, first bitter and then hazy, as brewers doubled down on hops and alcohol ascended to great heights,” writes @JoshMBernstein in his latest Imbibe feature. "Brewers mixed yeast strains with souring bacteria, sending beers on acid trips, then packed sour ales with puréed fruit. Decadent pastry stouts and 100-calorie hard seltzers offered excess and restraint, while slushy machines churned out frozen beer. All those flashy fermentations started feeling extra, and drinking them felt like a liquified double-dog dare. But increasingly, craft breweries are balancing bold impulses with cool moves toward crowd-pleasing lagers.” Head to the link in our profile to read more about why lagers continue to be touchstones for generations of drinkers, and how brewers are finding new inspiration in the classic style. 📸 @matthew.gilson

node.accessibility_caption: Photo shared by Imbibe on September 06, 2021 tagging @bulldog_gin, @bolscocktails, @campariofficial, @cinzano.official, @cooperscraft, and @campariusa. May be an image of drink and indoor.

node.text: Only a few days left to register for Negroni Week 2021! Sign-ups close on Friday at noon PST, so if you haven’t had a chance to sign up yet or to complete your registration, be sure to head to NegroniWeek.com. We’re counting down the days to the start of this year’s festivities! ❤️🎉❤️🎉❤️ 📸 @ericmedsker

node.accessibility_caption: Photo by Imbibe in Greydon House with @cannonjacks, and @greydonhouse. May be an image of drink and indoor.

node.text: This iced update of classic Irish Coffee achieves new levels of deliciousness with the addition of cold-brew coffee, bitters, and boozy whipped cream. Check out the recipe from Jackson Cannon (@cannonjacks) for @GreydonHouse via the link in our profile. 📸 Tim Williams

node.accessibility_caption: Photo shared by Imbibe on September 04, 2021 tagging @siobhan.egan_photo, @refinerywritingstudio, @chefarmermatthew, and @countrymanpress. May be an image of food.

node.text: “While craft brews are all the rage these days, Georgia was ahead of the trend as far back as 1743,” writes the James Beard Award–nominated chef and farmer Matthew Raiford (@chefarmermatthew) in Bress ’n’ Nyam: Gullah Geechee Recipes from a Sixth-Generation Farmer, co-authored with Amy Paige Condon. The book (the title is a Gullah phrase meaning “bless and eat”) digs into both Raiford’s family history and the influential foodways of the Gullah Geechee. From his family-run farm in coastal Brunswick, Georgia—originally purchased and tended by Raiford’s great-great-great-grandfather Jupiter Gillard—the chef creates and shares heritage and updated recipes, like his basic beer bread. “This bread is inspired by the coast’s long history with craft beer,” Raiford says, referring to the ale-bound hops and barley first grown and brewed on Jekyll Island in the mid-18th century by Major William Horton. Serve warm slices of the freshly baked bread alongside Raiford’s whipped feta for a comforting fall snack any time of day. Check out the recipe via the link in our profile, and be sure to order a copy of this excellent book. 📸 @siobhan.egan_photo

node.accessibility_caption: Photo shared by Imbibe on September 03, 2021 tagging @cooperscraft. May be an image of 1 person, drink and text.

node.text: For us, it wouldn’t be Negroni Week without a Boulevardier in the mix, and we’re excited to have @CoopersCraft joining as a sponsor of this year’s initiative and supporter of Negroni Week nonprofit partner, The Helen David Relief Fund (@thehdrf). To get ready for mixing those Boulevardiers, we’ll be sharing more about their excellent Barrel Reserve 100 Proof Bourbon in the weeks to come, but in the meantime, be sure to follow @CoopersCraft to learn more about their bourbons. 🥃

node.accessibility_caption: Photo shared by Imbibe on September 03, 2021 tagging @dylanandjeni. May be an image of drink and indoor.

node.text: Looking for some easy cocktail recipes for the long weekend? We’ve rounded up some of our favorites, including the Americano, pictured above. Head to the link in our profile to check out the full list. 📸 @dylanandjeni

node.accessibility_caption: Photo by Imbibe on September 02, 2021. May be an image of text.

node.text: Negroni Week shirts are back in stock! If you missed out on the first run of shirts, now’s your chance to snag one before they sell out for good. And remember: $5 of every shirt goes to Negroni Week nonprofit partner @MuttvilleSF, which cares for and finds loving homes for senior dogs. Hurry on over to the link in our profile to order yours before they’re gone!
